page.title: 06Change-Urban Renewal.
page.content: Plans have been drawn up for change in Kirkintilloch.This will mean many changes in the town centre. The plan includes a relief road which will mean that almost half of the main street will be pedestrianised.New shopping precincts,car parking,offices and a new public librarary will be built. There now follows notes taken from an interview with Strathkelvin District Councillor James Barker discussing the proposed redevelopment of the town centre. {Interview with Councillor Barker: Q.Could you briefly describe some of your duties as a councillor? A.As a Councillor I am involved in housing,and planning applications.For example-If someone wants to build an extension to their home,we have to examine their proposed alterations and approve or reject them.
